metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17234 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the H5O__chunk_deserialize() function in H5Ocache.c in the HDF HDF5 through 1.10.3 library allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted HDF5 file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-fortran-102 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-hl-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-fortran-102 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-fortran-102 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.5+repack-1~exp1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.5+repack-1~exp1').
